cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles SW of Port-au-Prince, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: continuing north, then turning NW/NNW toward the Bahamas and the waters just east of the Florida peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Central / Northern Bahamas (likely Grand Bahama vicinity); no Florida landfall currently forecast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida Atlantic coast from Miami–Dade northward through the Space Coast, especially Broward and Palm Beach counties
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible beginning late Wednesday night; a slight westward shift could bring hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center tracks close to the coast, surge of 3–5 ft above ground could occur along the Broward coastline including Port Everglades inlet.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could drop 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, producing urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and minor coastal beach erosion beginning Wednesday.
